summary: This document is an FBI interview summary (302 form) with a female victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The victim describes in detail the grooming process, sexual abuse, and psychological manipulation she endured from approximately age 14, including group encounters, travel to various properties, and the roles of Epstein and Maxwell. She also discusses the long-term impact on her life and relationships.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary accused in the sexual abuse case. The victim describes him as her abuser who engaged in sexual acts with her and other girls, often with Ghislaine Maxwell's involvement. He is depicted as controlling, manipulative, and normalizing the abuse.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's partner who actively participated in grooming and normalizing the sexual abuse of the victim and other girls. She took on a 'sister' role, arranged travel, and was present during group sexual encounters.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Epstein's lawyer who called the victim to demand $10,000 for an apartment her mother was subletting in New York.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's brother who accompanied them on a trip to New Mexico and was on a flight to New York. He also reminded the victim of an incident from her childhood.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Met by the victim at a Golden Globes party with Epstein. Epstein jokingly told Weinstein 'hands off my girl.'

persons.name: Michelle
persons.context: A friend of the victim who introduced her to the drink White Russian. She was involved in sexual conduct with Epstein and may have worked for his company.

persons.name: Glenn Dubin
persons.context: Potentially on a flight from Florida to New York in May 1998 with the victim.

persons.name: Eva Dubin
persons.context: Potentially on a flight from Florida to New York in May 1998 with the victim.

persons.name: Jeff Schantz
persons.context: Name presented to the victim; she did not know him.

persons.name: Henry Gereky
persons.context: Name presented to the victim; she said it sounded familiar.

persons.name: Maria Minsky
persons.context: Name presented to the victim; she did not know her.

connections.description: Described as a 'power couple dynamic' who worked together to groom, manipulate, and sexually abuse the victim and other girls. Their relationship was unclear to the victim (couple, married, assistant).
Indyke is identified as Epstein's lawyer who contacted the victim about a debt.
Mark is Jeffrey Epstein's brother. He traveled with them and was on flights.
Epstein introduced the victim to Weinstein at a party, indicating a social acquaintance.
Michelle was a friend of the victim and was involved in sexual conduct with Epstein; Maxwell was present in group settings.
Described as Epstein's ex-girlfriend who stayed friends. Possibly involved in abuse scenarios.

events.title: Period of Sexual Abuse and Grooming
events.description: The victim, starting around age 14, describes a pattern of grooming (movies, shopping, pool time) escalating to sexual abuse by Epstein, often with Maxwell's involvement, in Florida and New York. Includes group encounters and one-on-one abuse.

events.title: Epstein's Initial Arrest
events.description: The victim learned of Jeffrey Epstein's initial arrest and realized there were many other girls involved, leading to feelings of guilt and isolation.

events.title: Victim's Realization and Break
events.description: Approximately in 2002, with help from a boyfriend, the victim realized her relationship with Epstein and Maxwell was abusive and not right, leading to her breaking free.

events.title: Travel to New Mexico and New York
events.description: The victim recounts multiple trips on Epstein's private jet to his properties in New Mexico and New York, often with Epstein, Maxwell, and others. Abuse typically occurred at the destinations.

events.title: Apartment Debt Call
events.description: Epstein's lawyer, Darren Indyke, called the victim demanding $10,000 for a New York apartment her mother was subletting, after she had begun to distance herself.

locations: Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's mansion, pool house, movie theaters)
New York, New York (Epstein's mansion, 45 Wall Street apartment)
Bear Lakes (gated community in Florida where victim lived)
keyFacts: The victim was approximately 14 years old when the sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein began, following a grooming process involving Ghislaine Maxwell.
Ghislaine Maxwell played a central role in normalizing the abuse, acting as a 'big sister,' organizing travel, and actively participating in or directing group sexual encounters.
Abuse occurred in multiple locations including Epstein's properties in Palm Beach, New York, and New Mexico, and involved both one-on-one and group settings with other girls.
The victim describes a pattern where Epstein never used protection during sex, leading to pregnancy scares, and that he took Polaroid photographs of her.
The document details the long-term psychological impact on the victim, including trust issues, anxiety, depression, and damaged family relationships.
